intro: Stigmaphyllon jatrophifolium, commonly known as the Brazilian buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and palmate leaves. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Its botanical features include hairy stems and showy, cup-shaped blooms that attract pollinators. It is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant appearance.
